message: In order to read from Amazon S3 I would have to do a cross-domain request via JSONP. Since you can't set headers for JSONP requests I will have to use a "Query String Request Authentication Alternative"
I'd like to read an object from a bucket on Amazon S3. My plan was to calculate the Authorization header in KRL, then use jQuery on the client to get the object.
http://api.jquery.com/jQuery.ajax/
why couldn't you set headers for JSONP ?
Yeah, I still gotta turn it into a  module, but all the hard work is done at this point.
I've got lot of ideas for using S3 but nothing specific right now.

I'm happy with the way it works now. You provide the aws-id and secret key, the module provides a URL that's good for 5 minutes. I'm just adding the URL to the test page and then you click on the link to retrieve the object from the s3 bucket.

So if you have a resource on S3 that you want to provide limited access to, you set up a ruleset to validate access, then provide the URL to the end user. They have 5 minutes to start downloading the resource.
sounds easy

I removed that policy and now I'm getting the expected 'Access Denied' error.
I put the test user in a group and gave the group full access to S3, so it was able to read the file.
